The government has warned banks of “de-authorisation” of branches if they refuse to accept taxes under the amnesty scheme PMGKY, which ends on March 31. The Finance Ministry, in a communication to heads of banks which are authorised to accept deposits under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana (PMGKY), asked them to issue directions to all branches for making necessary changes in their system/software to accept the tax.
“Non-compliance of this order may be viewed seriously and may lead to de-authorisation of that branch in case of refusalto accept taxes,” the ministry said.

Post demonetisation, the government came out with PMGKY under which people holding unaccounted cash can deposit them in bank accounts till March 31 by paying 50 per cent tax plus penalty. A quarter of the total sum will have to be parked in a non-interest bearing deposit for four years. The scheme opened on December 1.
Government warns banks over non-acceptance of PMGKY tax
Operation Clean Money was launched on 31st January, 2017 by the Income Tax department for e-verification of large deposits made between the period of 9th November and 30th December, 2016.

Income tax department sent E-mail and SMS to approximately 18 lakh taxpayers who made suspicious deposits over Rs 5 lakh during the 50-day demonetisation period, as part of the initiative. The operation is primarily aimed to verify cash transaction status (exchange/savings of banned notes) of tax payers during the demonetisation period.

More than 7 Lakh people logged online and acknowledged to have made such deposits. The biggest challenge the Income Tax Department is facing is that a large number of people are not registered on the income tax portal.

Data analytics will be used to select cases for verification, based on approved risk criteria. If the case is selected for verification, request for additional information and its response will also be communicated electronically. The information on the online portal will be dynamic getting updated on receipt of new information, response and data analytics. The response of taxpayer will be assessed against available information. In case explanation of source of cash is found justified, the verification will be closed without any need to visit Income Tax Office.

The verification will also be closed if the cash deposit is declared under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojna(PMGKY). It is an amnesty scheme for the defaulters to turn black money into white by declaring their unaccounted money. The last date to declare unaccounted money is set as 31st March. However, black money can only be converted to white after paying tax, surcharge, and penalty of up to 49.90percent of the total amount. Plus, the 25 percent of the money left after the deductions will be locked up in the bank interest-free for the next 4 years.
Non-disclosure of the undisclosed income before 31st March, 2017 will attract tax, surcharge, and penalty amounting to 77.25 percent along with prosecution.

The money collected under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojna will be used to contribute to the cause of underprivileged of the country. The decision to give another opportunity to declare undisclosed income is observed as an important step to bridge the gap between the rich and the poor of the country.
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

This section attempts to help you easily navigate through the pages of this portal. We strive to provide you a pleasant experience while browsing the portal.Sections of this portal Sections of this website are Dashboard, Blog, Talk, Feedback, FAQ, About Us, Contact Us, Sitemap, Terms & Conditions.
Viewing information in various file formats

To view the information properly, your browser need to have the required plug-ins. All the information provided by this website is available in PDF, and HTML format. In case, your browser doesn’t have the required plug-ins or softwares, you can download it for free from the internet.
The accessibility option provided by this website allows you to increase the text size and changing the contrast scheme for clear visibility and better readability.

You can change the text to smaller or bigger from its standard size on this portal. You can choose any one of the three options provided: Small : It displays information in the smallest font size available on the portal. Medium : It is the standard default font size of the portal. Large : It displays information in the smallest font size available on the portal.

Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojna, 2016 (PMGKY) is an amnesty scheme launched in December 2016 by the Government of India. This scheme provides one more opportunity to declare unaccounted money till 31st March 2017. The Pradhan Mantri Kalyan Yojna can only be availed to declare income in the form of cash or bank deposits in Indian Bank accounts and not in the form of assets/stocks/overseas accounts.

Anyone who declares his/her undisclosed income by 31st March 2017 under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojna, will have to pay tax, surcharge, and penalty of up to 49.90% of the total amount. The 25% of the rest money left after the deductions will be locked up in the bank interest-free for the next 4 years. Non-disclosure of the undisclosed income will attract tax, surcharge, and penalty amounting to 77.25% along with prosecution.

The identity of the person declaring undisclosed income under the Pradhan Mantri Garin Kalyan Yojna will be kept confidential and the income declared translatable="false" under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojna shall not be taxable under the income-tax Act, 1961.

The money collected under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojna will be used to contribute to the cause of underprivileged of the country. The decision to give another opportunity to declare undisclosed income is observed as an important step to bridge the gap between the rich and the poor of the country.
What is Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Deposit Scheme (PMGKDS), 2016 ?

Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Deposit Scheme (PMGKDS), 2016 is a scheme notified by the Government of India on December 16, 2016 which is applicable to every declarant under the Taxation and Investment Regime for Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana, 2016.
Who is eligible to deposit in PMGKS?

The deposit under this Scheme shall be made by any person who declares undisclosed income under sub-section (1) of section 199C of the Taxation and Investment Regime for Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana, 2016.
In what form will the deposits under this scheme be held?
The Deposits shall be held at the credit of the declarant in Bond Ledger Accounts (BLA) maintained with Reserve Bank of India.
Which are the authorized agencies where the application and amount of deposit will be accepted?

Application and amount for the deposit (in the form of Bond Ledger Account) shall be received by any banking company, other than Co-operative Banks, to which the Banking Regulation Act, 1949 (10 of 1949) applies (Authorised Banks).
Where can declarants get the application form?
Application for the deposit will be available at branches of Authorised Banks. It is also available in the Reserve Bank of India website.

This is a list of States of India by projected own tax revenues of their governments (excluding the shares from Union tax pool) assessed for the year 2010–15 by the Thirteenth Finance Commission with figures in crore of Indian Rupees. Data for Union territories are not available.
